Date of Report: 2023-12-08  Mr.   Ferland’s   prac � ce   includes   regular   contribu � ons   to   catastrophic   designa � on   assessment  teams   where   he   provides   opinions   related   to   daily   func � on   of   individuals   su ff ering   from   serious  physical,   psychological   and   cogni � ve   impairments. PURPOSE OF REFERRAL :  This   therapist   received   a   request   from   Ms.   Balduzzi’s   legal   representa � ve   to   re-engage   with   Ms.  Balduzzi   in   order   to   address   some   ongoing   issues   with   her   home   accessibility. She   is   currently  engaging   in   ac � vi � es   such   as   bathtub   transfers   which   place   her   at   risk   for   falls   and   injuries.  Furthermore,   there   were   a   number   of   home   modi fi ca � ons   iden � fi ed   by   Ms.   Balduzzi   which   she  requested   be   reviewed   and   addressed   in   the   context   of   OT   Treatment   delivery   proposed   in   this  report.  An   OCF18   for   this   reassessment   was   submi � ed   to   the   insurer   and   approved   in   full.   A  subsequent   OCF18   will   be   submi � ed   for   considera � on   to   allow   this   therapist   to   engage   with   Ms.  Balduzzi on an ongoing basis to address the mul � ple areas of concern she iden � fi ed.  SUMMARY OF FINDINGS:  Ms.   Balduzzi   is   an   87-year-old   woman   who   was   involved   in   a   car   vs.   pedestrian   collision   while  she   was   walking   from   her   car   to   a   Tim   Horton’s   restaurant   on   February   14,   2017.   As   a   result   of  the subject MVA, Ms. Balduzzi sustained the following injuries:  ●   Fractured le �   ankle (ORIF, 13 screws and a plate)  ●   Lacera � on below the le �   knee  ●   Subsequent MRSA infec � on in the leg  At   the   � me   of   this   assessment,   Ms.   Balduzzi   was   found   to   have   deteriorated   from   a   mobility  standpoint,   both   in   terms   of   speed   of   ambula � on   and   in   terms   of   overall   walking   tolerance.  She   u � lizes   PSW   services   once   weekly   to   foster   a   community   ou � ng   such   as   the   bank   and   is  otherwise   receiving   limited   assistance   from   her   daughter.   Her   home   was   found   to   be   in   a   state  of   disorganiza � on,   with   many   rooms   fi lled   with   various   belongings   placed   on   the   fl oor. Date of Report: 2023-12-08  Balduzzi   noted   that   she   struggles   with   tasks   such   as   bed   transfers   and   bathtub   transfers   and   also  noted   issues   u � lizing   her   outdoor   pla � orm   li �   during   winter   months. INFORMED CONSENT STATEMENT:  This   therapist   has   reviewed   issues   related   to   consent   as   per   the   requirements   outlined   by   the  College of Occupa � onal Therapists of Ontario:  ●   An   occupa � onal   therapy   assessment   is   to   be   conducted   by   this   therapist,   a   registered  occupa � onal therapist with the College of Occupa � onal Therapists of Ontario (COTO).  ●   The assessment has been requested by her legal representa � ve, Mr. Paul Auerbach.  ●   The   purpose   of   this   assessment   is   to   assess   Ms.   Balduzzi’s   current   func � onal   status   as   it  relates to the ability to complete the reported pre-accident ac � vi � es of daily living.  ●   The   proposed   assessment   will   include:   an   interview,   a   physical   assessment,   and  observa � ons   of   the   ability   to   complete   func � onal   tasks   within   and   around   the   home   as  well as educa � on on safe means of comple � ng ac � vi � es of daily living if required.  ●   Due   to   the   physical   nature   of   the   assessment,   pain   and   fa � gue   are   possible   temporary  side e ff ects.  ●   Recommenda � ons   may   be   provided   at   the   conclusion   of   the   assessment.   These  recommenda � ons may include:  o   Occupa � onal Therapy Treatment  o   Assis � ve Devices  o   Referral to other prac � � oners  o   Support services  ●   A   submission   for   funding   will   be   submi � ed   to   the   insurer   for   any   goods   and/or   services  on   an   OCF18   –   Assessment   and   Treatment   Plan.   The   insurer   may   approve   or   deny   the  plan   (in   part   or   in   whole). Funding   for   the  requested goods and/or services may ul � mately be declined.  ●   Ms. Balduzzi may choose to par � cipate or decline any or all of the proposed assessment.  ●   A   report   documen � ng   this   assessment   will   be   completed   and   copies   will   be   provided   to  the following par � es via secure transmission (fax or encrypted email a � achment):  McNally Gervan c/o Paul Auerbach  Travelers Insurance  Following   this   therapist’s   explana � on   Ms.   Balduzzi   granted   informed   consent   for   this   therapist  to proceed with the assessment and any subsequent interven � ons.  ______________________________________________________________________________  Mary Balduzzi   Claim #: APP2699699   Page   3   of   14

PRE-ACCIDENT MEDICAL HISTORY:  Ms.   Balduzzi   is   an   87-year-old   female   who   resides   alone   in   a   single-family   bungalow   home   in  O � awa,   Ontario.   She   provided   the   following   pre-exis � ng   medical   history   when   fi rst   assessed   by  this therapist in 2019:  ●   Complete   reversed   shoulder   replacement   in   2010,   le � -sided,   as   a   result   of   a   slip   and   fall  where she sha � ered her shoulder.  ●   Hypothyroidism  ●   Sleep apnea  ●   Thalassemia trait  ●   Osteoporosis  As   a   result   of   her   shoulder-related   impairments,   Ms.   Balduzzi   reported   that   she   obtained  assistance   with   showering   and   hair   care   once   weekly   from   a   Personal   Support   Worker   provided  through the CCAC.  MECHANISM OF INJURY:  Ms.   Balduzzi   reported   that   she   drove   her   vehicle   to   a   local   Tim   Horton’s   to   purchase   a  Valen � ne’s   Day   donut   on   the   date   of   loss.   She   parked   her   vehicle   and   began   walking   to   the  co ff ee   shop   when   a   vehicle   travelling   through   the   parking   lot   struck   her   on   the   le �   side   of   her  body,   throwing   her   to   the   ground.   She   indicated   that   her   le �   leg   slid   under   the   vehicle   but   that  the   vehicle   never   drove   over   her   leg. NATURE OF INJURY:  As a result of the subject MVA, Ms. Balduzzi sustained the following injuries:  ●   Fractured le �   ankle (ORIF, 13 screws and a plate).  ●   Lacera � on below the le �   knee.  ●   Subsequent MRSA infec � on in the leg.  ______________________________________________________________________________  Mary Balduzzi   Claim #: APP2699699   Page   4   of   14
